intro: Cressa sericea, commonly known as silky cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Cressa sericea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has also been used in traditional medicine.
